newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Ingosstrakh to push forward at home, CIS.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Ingosstrakh to push forward at home, CIS.

text.p: Russia's second-biggest insurance company, AO Ingosstrakh, plans to occupy a leading position in Russia and Commonwealth of Independent States markets, focusing on property and liability insurance, it said on Wednesday.
"Insurance markets in Russia and the CIS must become the group's main challenge," Ingosstrakh said in a statement outlining its strategy for the next 15 years.
"The situation on the Russian property and liability insurance markets, where the company's position is especially strong, are of special interest for Ingosstrakh."
Ingosstrakh said it holds 10 percent of the Russian property insurance market and 32 percent of the liability insurance market.
Ingosstrakh, which traditionally specialises in insurance abroad plans to develop its foreign business and venture into voluntary medical insurance and travel insurance for Russians, it said.
"The group will strive to take the position of a well-known leader on the Russian market of voluntary insurance and to become one of the world's biggest insurance companies," it said.
Ingosstrakh's 1995 pre-tax profit rose to 384.30 billion roubles ($72.3 million) from 41.00 billion roubles in 1994.
Ingosstrakh plans to diversify its activities by investing in Russian equities and real estate.
The company said it was working in an unfavourable environment where only 48 percent of Russians trust insurance companies and 57 percent never used insurance.
Ingosstrakh quoted official statistics saying Russians use less than one percent of income for insurance service.
In the first quarter of this year insurance premiums amounted to about 1.30 percent of gross domestic product, Ingosstrakh said.
